headline: Musicians’ Union welcomes government ban on inflated gig ticket resales
summary: The union said the move to ban resales for profit would help to maintain the relationship between artists and their fans.

headline: AI data center projects drive up memory chip prices. Here's why.
summary: As tech giants Amazon (AMZN), Alphabet (GOOG, GOOGL), and Meta Platforms (META) up their capex spending on artificial intelligence and AI data centers, how is the demand for AI chips affecting pricing for everyday memory chips in consumer devices? Yahoo Finance tech editor Dan Howley comes on Market Catalysts to explain the pull AI bullishness is having on memory chip manufacturers, defining such terms like DRAM (Dynamic Random-Access Memory), HBM (High Bandwidth Memory), and DDR (Double Data Rate). To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Catalysts.

headline: Blockfusion, Owner-Operator of a Strategically Located Clean Energy-Powered Data Center, to Go Public via Business Combination with Blue Acquisition Corp.
summary: Blockfusion USA, Inc. ("Blockfusion" or the "Company"), a data center infrastructure company, and Blue Acquisition Corp. (Nasdaq: BACC) ("Blue Acquisition"), a publicly traded special purpose acquisition company, today announced that the companies have entered into a definitive business combination agreement (the "Business Combination Agreement"), dated as of November 19, 2025. headline: AI Chips Update - Europe Advances AI with France's First Exascale Supercomputer
summary: AMD and Eviden have been selected to construct Alice Recoque, Europe's second and France's first Exascale supercomputer, which will significantly enhance the region’s AI and scientific computing capabilities. Powered by next-generation AMD CPUs and GPUs, the project underscores a joint European effort to support high performance computing and AI applications with a commitment to energy efficiency. This initiative, with a budget of 544 million euros, represents a significant investment in...
